**Basic example**

Specify just the model and the field names and each field will be rendered according
to it's field type.

```js
<ModelForm
    layout="horizontal"
    model={UserModel}
    fieldNames={['firstName', 'lastName', 'email', 'isActive', 'dateJoined']}
/>
```

**Control rendering**

Here we take full control of where each form item is rendered. Using `ModelForm.Item` and
`ModelForm.Field` without specifying `widget` we defer to the field default but can specify
that if we want to control how the input is rendered.

```js
/**
 * A component that gets passed the field details for 'superUser' which we use to
 * conditionally render `userPermissions` field. Note that `props` will have any
 * extra props you pass to `Field` on it.
 */
function ConditionalPermissions(props) {
    // Whenever isSuperuser is true don't render permissions box
    if (props.input.value) {
        return null;
    }
    return (
        <ModelForm.Item
            name="userPermissions"
            labelCol={{ span: 0 }}
            wrapperCol={{ span: 20 }}
        />
    );
}

function UserForm({ footer, name, ...rest }) {
    footer = footer === undefined && (
        <ModelFormButtonBar
            renderLeft={buttons => [
                <ModelForm.Button submitOnClick action="SAVE_AND_SEND_INVITATION">
                  Save and send invitation
                </ModelForm.Button>,
                ...buttons,
            ]}
        />
    );
    return (
        <ModelForm layout="horizontal" name={name} model={UserModel} footer={footer} {...rest}>
            <ModelForm.Item label="Name">
                <Col span={11}>
                    <ModelForm.Field name="firstName" placeholder="First Name" />
                </Col>
                <Col span={11} offset={2}>
                    <ModelForm.Field name="lastName" placeholder="Last Name" />
                </Col>
            </ModelForm.Item>
            <ModelForm.Item name="email" help="Please double check your email" />
            <ModelForm.Item
                name="isActive"
                widget={(
                  <SwitchWidget
                     checkedChildren="Active"
                     unCheckedChildren="Inactive"
                  />
                )}
            />
            <h3>Permissions</h3>
            <p>Choose individual permissions or promote to super user. Note that super users have access to everything.</p>
            <ModelForm.Item name="isSuperuser" widget={SwitchWidget} />
            <Field
                name="isSuperuser"
                component={ConditionalPermissions}
                    
            />
        </ModelForm>
    );
}
<UserForm name="customForm" onSubmit={logger.log} />
```
